body.directions: Listen to the audio of a word, then answer the question that follows

body.textVersion: Audio for 你的电话号码是多少？ Nǐde diànhuàhàomǎ shì duōshǎo?

body.quiz: Which of the following is another way of asking the question in the audio?
body.answer: 你的电话是多少？Nǐde diànhuà shì duōshǎo?
options: 你叫什么名字？Nǐ jiàoshénme míngzi?
你从哪里来？Nǐ cóng nǎlǐ lái?
body.correct: Job well done! Sometimes we say 电话 diànhuà instead of 电话号码 diànhuà màomǎ for the word “phone number.”
body.incorrect: So close! Please listen again. Pay attention to each syllable and repeat the audio when needed.

body.textVersion: Audio for 五五二三八七九 wǔwǔèr sānbāqījiǔ.

body.quiz: Which of the following digit is not said in the phone number in the audio?
body.correct: You’ve got an ear for numbers! Excellently done! Saying phone numbers in Chinese is easy as one-two-three.
body.incorrect: Oops…please listen again. Pay special attention to the digits said at the second half of the sentence. You can refer to earlier in this lesson “All About Counting” for more information on the digits 0 to 10.

body.textVersion: Audio for 我的电话号码是… Wǒde diànhuàhàomǎ shì…

body.quiz: Which of the following can be used to complete the sentence in the audio?
body.correct: Fantastic! The phrase in the audio ”我的电话号码是… Wǒde diànhuà hàomǎ shì…” (My phone number is…) should be followed by one’s phone number.
body.incorrect: Oops…please listen again. Try to catch each syllable and put together the words for the phrase. Repeat the audio if needed.
